apps/index.title: Other Apps
apps/index.description: Here is a list of apps that are generally good to use and can come in handy in day to day tasks. The apps are separated into 4 broad categories Developer Tools, Productivity Tools, Office Apps and Other.

apps/octave.title: Octave
apps/octave.description: Octave is a programming language for scientific computing.

apps/settings.title: App Settings
apps/settings.description: These settings are optional. Some of them are highly subjective and should not be considered as the best settings. To each is own.

cpp.description: Make sure you have installed Xcode Command Line Tools. Check the C++ version to make sure it is Clang 4.0+.

docker/index.title: Docker
docker/index.description: Docker is a platform for developers and sysadmins to develop, ship, and run applications. Docker lets you quickly assemble applications from components and eliminates the friction that can come when shipping code. Docker lets you get your code tested and deployed into production as fast as possible.

docker/tips-and-tricks.title: Tips and Tricks
docker/tips-and-tricks.description: A collection of useful tips and tricks for Docker.

docker/useful-commands.title: Useful Commands
docker/useful-commands.description: Here follows a list of useful Docker commands with useful flags for each

emacs.title: Emacs
emacs.description: Emacs is a family of text editors that are characterized by their extensibility. The manual for the most widely used variant, GNU Emacs, describes it as the extensible, customizable, self-documenting, real-time display editor.

git/gitignore.description: Create the file ~/.gitignore as shown below

git/index.description: What's a developer without Git? To install, run:

go.title: Go
go.description: Go is an open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software.

heroku.title: Heroku
heroku.description: Heroku is a Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) that simplifies deploying your apps online.

homebrew/usage.description: To install a package (or Formula in Homebrew vocabulary) simply type:

iterm/ack.description: ack is a search tool designed for code. It's built to be a replacement for

iterm/index.title: iTerm2
iterm/index.description: iTerm2 is an open source replacement for Apple's Terminal. It's highly customizable and comes with a lot of useful features.

iterm/tree.title: tree
iterm/tree.description: tree is a recursive directory listing command that produces a depth indented listing of files.

iterm/zsh.title: Zsh
iterm/zsh.description: The Z shell (also known as zsh) is a Unix shell that is built on top of bash

java/index.title: Java
java/index.description: Using Java requires you to install a JDK ("Java Development Kit") or JRE ("Java Runtime Environment").

java/sdkman.title: SDKMAN!
java/sdkman.description: SDKMAN! is a tool for managing parallel versions of multiple software development kits on most Unix-based systems. It provides a convenient command line interface (CLI) and API for installing, switching, removing and listing candidates.

jetbrains-ides.title: JetBrains IDEs
jetbrains-ides.description: JetBrains is a company creating tools for developers. Their mission is: We make professional software development a more productive and enjoyable experience. In this section a number of IDEs (integrated development environment) as well as a selection of features will be presented.

latex.title: LaTeX
latex.description: LaTeX, which is pronounced Â«Lah-techÂ» or Â«Lay-techÂ», is a document preparation system for high-quality typesetting. It is most often used for medium-to-large technical or scientific documents but it can be used for almost any form of publishing.

nodejs.title: Node.js
nodejs.description: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

postgresql.title: PostgreSQL
postgresql.description: PostgreSQL is an open source relational database management system (RDBMS). It is the default database for macOS server.

python/index.title: Python
python/index.description: macOS, like Linux, ships with Python already installed.

python/ipython.title: IPython
python/ipython.description: IPython is an improved Python shell than the one you get from running python in the command-line. It has many cool functions (running Unix commands from the Python shell, easy copy & paste, creating Matplotlib charts in-line etc.). You can find all functions in the documentation.

python/numpy.title: Numpy
python/numpy.description: The NumPy, SciPy and Matplotlib scientific libraries for Python are always a little tricky to install from source because they have all these dependencies they need to build correctly.

python/pip.title: Pip
python/pip.description: macOS comes with Python so there's a chance pip is already installed on your machine.

python/virtualenv.description: Virtualenv is a tool that lets you create an

references.title: References
references.description: Thank you for all the awesome pages and documentation below which helped set this up.

ruby/index.title: Ruby
ruby/index.description: macOS comes with Ruby installed, but as we don't want to be messing with operating system core files we're going to use the tools rbenv and ruby-build to manage and install our Ruby versions for our development environment.

ruby/rubygems.description: RubyGems, the Ruby package manager, should be installed on your machine if you previously have installed Ruby. Verify this by running:

rust.title: Rust
rust.description: Rust is a systems programming language that runs blazingly fast, prevents segfaults, and guarantees thread safety.

scala.title: Scala
scala.description: Make sure you have Java installed, the instructions are provided here.

security.description: A development machine should be secured against threats as well as any other machine \(or even especially a development machine\). Therefore we will setup

sublime-text/index.title: Sublime Text
sublime-text/index.description: Sublime Text is a widely used editor that describes it self as a sophisticated text editor for code, markup and prose.

sublime-text/plugins.title: Plugins
sublime-text/plugins.description: - Alignment: Easy alignment of multiple selections and multi-line selections

sublime-text/preferences.title: Preferences
sublime-text/preferences.description: This is an example of User Settings for a basic development but please feel free to modify or update as per your choice.

vagrant.title: Vagrant
vagrant.description: Create and configure lightweight, reproducible, and portable development environments. Vagrant is a tool for managing virtual machines via a simple to use command line interface.

vim.title: Vim
vim.description: Vim is a highly configurable text editor built to make creating and changing any kind of text very efficient. It is included as "vi" with most UNIX systems and with Apple macOS.

visual-studio-code.title: Visual Studio Code
visual-studio-code.description: Visual Studio Code is a lightweight code editor with support for many programming languages through extensions

xcode.title: Xcode
xcode.description: Xcode is an integrated development environment for macOS containing a suite of software development tools developed by Apple for developing software for macOS, iOS, watchOS and tvOS.
